channel.title: Septic Systems
channel.description: Updated Septic Systems content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Holiday SepticSmart Reminder Postcard
item.description:
Remind your customers, homeowners or community to properly manage their septic systems during the holidays! Here is a postcard to customize and use as a mailer.

  • Holiday SepticSmart Reminder Postcard (PDF)(1 pg, 3 MB)
item.dc:creator: kfarber

item.title: SepticSmart Decentralized Wastewater Webcasts
item.description:
Webcast Announcement: Â SepticSmart Week 2016: Tools and Outreach

Thursday, September 8, 2016 from 1:00pm to 2:00pm (ET)

This webinar explores tools and outreach efforts for SepticSmart Week 2016, September 19 - 23, 2016.

Each year, EPA holds SepticSmart Week with outreach activities to encourage homeowners and communities to care for and maintain their septic systems.

ViewÂ the wecast announcement for details on how to reserve a space and attend the webinar.

  • Webcast: SepticSmart Week 2016: Tools and Outreach (PDF)(1 pg, 391 K)

item.title: SepticSmart Week Save the Date Flyer
item.description:
Each year, EPA holds SepticSmart Week with outreach activities to encourage homeowners and communities to care for and maintain their septic systems.

During SepticSmart Week, EPA seeks to inform homeowners on proper septic system care and maintenance, assist local agencies in promoting homeowner education and awareness, and educate local decision makers aboutÂ infrastructureÂ optionsÂ to improve and sustain their communities.

View, print, and download the flyer forÂ SepticSmart Week 2016 fromÂ September 19-23, 2016.

item.dc:creator: kfarber

item.title: SepticSmart Week 2016
item.description:
Announcing SepticSmart Week 2016!

September 19-23, 2016

Each year, EPA holds SepticSmart Week with outreach activities to encourage homeowners and communities to care for and maintain their septic systems.

During SepticSmart Week, EPA seeks to inform homeowners on proper septic system care and maintenance, assist local agencies in promoting homeowner education and awareness, and educate local decision makers aboutÂ infrastructureÂ optionsÂ to improve and sustain their communities.

Join the effort to raise awareness by:

  • Hosting an event or training
  • Sharing SepticSmart materials
  • Scheduling service for your system
  • Declaring a SepticSmart proclamation
  • Getting your local and state decision makers involved
  • Participating in the conversation on social media #SepticSmartWeek
SepticSmart Week ProclamationsÂ -Â Check out theÂ states and leaders who have declared SepticSmart Week 2016 in their communities:
  • Governor Walker, State of Alaska
  • Governor Markell, State of Delaware
  • Governor Otter, State of Idaho
  • President Norkus, Town Council, Beverly Shores, Indiana
  • President DeLaney, Town Council, Chesterton, Indiana
  • Executive Director Vicari, Storm Water Management District Board, Gary, Indiana
  • Chairperson Ton, Northwestern Indiana Regional Planning Commission
  • Town Council, Ogden Dunes, Indiana
  • Board of Commissioners, Porter County, Indiana
  • Governor Dayton, State of Minnesota
  • Chair Hancock, Board of Commissioners, Dona Ana County, New Mexico
  • Governor Brown, State of Oregon
  • Governor Wolf, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
  • Governor Shumlin, State of Vermont
  • Governor Inslee, State of Washington

SepticSmart Week SAVE THE DATE flyerÂ - Download,Â print, and share your flyer to let everyone know that you are participating in SepticSmart Week 2016.

Visit our Outreach Toolkit for more SepticSmart materials targeted to homeowners. All materials are free for download and contain print recommendations.

Share SepticSmart!
If you participate in SepticSmart Week 2016, tell us about it. Send an email describing your participation, training, event, or other activity, including photos to:Â decentralized@epa.gov

View information about past SepticSmart Week efforts.
item.dc:creator: kfarber

item.title: SepticSmart Week 2015
item.description:
Each year, EPA holds SepticSmart Week with outreach activities to encourage homeowners and communities to care for and maintain their septic systems.

During SepticSmart Week, EPA seeks to inform homeowners on proper septic system care and maintenance, assist local agencies in promoting homeowner education and awareness, and educate local decision makers about infrastructure options to improve and sustain their communities.

Events and Activities for SepticSmart Week, September 21-25, 2015

  • SepticSmart Week Proclamations:
    • Governor Inslee, State of Washington
    • Governor Otter, State of Idaho
    • Governor Shumlin, State of Vermont
    • Governor Brown, State of Oregon
    • Governor Nixon, State of Missouri
    • General Assembly, State of Pennsylvania
      Â 
  • Proclamation Template:Â Want to develop a SepticSmart Week Proclamation in your area? Use theÂ proclamationÂ templateÂ to get started.
    Â 
  • Events and Activities: Looking to educate community members about the importance of proper care and maintenance of septic systems? Community activities are a great way to educate homeowners, local officials, and others.Â See some suggested events and activitiesÂ that can be supplemented with SepticSmart materials.

Community Highlights 2015

  • Education and Research: Read about the education and research by states and communities about septic systemsÂ to protect water quality.
